definition: La Paz, administrative capital of Bolivia
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: They belong to the Marquis of Carabas, " they replied."
sentences.chinese: “它们属于卡拉巴斯侯爵所有，”他们回答说。

sentences.english: "The Marquis of Carabas, sir, " said the cat, and he bowed very low.
sentences.chinese: “我的主人就是卡拉巴斯侯爵”猫答道，又深鞠一躬。

sentences.english: Ahora lo mandan a la embajada china acreditada en La Paz.
sentences.chinese: 现在他被派往中国驻拉巴斯大使馆。

sentences.english: Many of La Paz's residents swear the snow-line is gradually creeping upwards.
sentences.chinese: 许多拉巴斯市的居民发誓雪线在逐渐爬升。

sentences.english: And is this splendid castle also yours, my lord Marquis of Carabas?
sentences.chinese: 这富丽堂皇的城堡也是你的吗，我的了拉巴斯侯爵？

sentences.english: Hydrologists from La Paz are planning to measure the glacial loss of the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 拉巴斯的水文学家计划测量山脉冰川的损失量。

sentences.english: One road in particular, which goes north from Lasa Paz, is considered the most dangerous road in the world.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是从拉巴斯通往北边的一条路被认为是最危险的。

sentences.english: State-employed miners participate in a protest in La Paz October 10, 2006.
sentences.chinese: 国营矿工参加玻利维亚首都拉巴斯的抗议。

definition: San Salvador, capital of El Salvador

pinyin: Te4 gu3 xi1 jia1 er3 ba1
